content: don t print the last 4 pages why because all charts at the end of this pattern are presented twice once in landscape format to allow for larger print for those who will print and sticky tape the charts once in portrait format for those working on electronic devices who can zoom in on their device most knitters tend to work tighter when doing twisted stitches therefore choose 1 size larger needles than you d normally do for the yarn you use make sure you have enough yarn as this pattern needs a lot of yardage cuff and heel are designed for 2 different sizes the leg pattern is one size only but because there are a lot of stitches per round it should accommodate nearly any circumference of legs socks worked in regia 3ply - a sort of thick lace weight on us0/2mm needles with the larger cuff and larger heel fit normal women s feet therefore choose a yarn that s on the medium to thinner side of the fingering weight spectrum so as not have the socks come out too large unless you are really really concerned the socks won t fit your feet then consider a slightly thicker yarn and knit with a larger needle size pattern cuff the smaller sized cuff will fit only slender women s calves since the tiny cables draw in the fabric quite a bit if you have normal or more substantial calves than choose the larger cuff size loosely cast on 72 84 sts and join to start working in the round place a stitch marker at the beginning of the round and start working the 21 rounds of the smaller sized larger sized cuff chart repeat each chart line twice per round leg remove the stitch marker slip the last stitch you just worked purlwise from your right needle back onto your left needle and replace the stitch marker this maneuver shifts the beginning of the round by 1 stitch to the right start working the 76 rounds of leg chart repeating each chart line twice per round note on how to work the turquoise marked stitch in round 62 ktbl that st when you reach it for the first time i e in the middle of that round when you reach it for the 2nd time i e at the end of the round slip it purlwise onto your right needle remove the marker slip the st purlwise back onto the left needle and replace marker the st has now become the new first st of the next round the beginning of the round has shifted by 1 st to the right heel set-up you have the choice of heel size choose the smaller one for lower instep or slender feet choose the larger one for high instep and/or more substantial feet remove the stitch marker and then work then next stitches as follows for smaller heel only ktbl p1 k2togtw p1 ktbl twice p1 k2togtbl p1 ktbl
